headline: Quick Pickled Jalapeño Rings
description: Learn how to pickle jalapeños with this quick recipe for jalapeño rings pickled in vinegar, garlic, and oregano. Serve with nachos and on sandwiches.

video.description: Watch Chef John make quick-and-easy pickled peppers.
video.name: Quick Pickled Jalapeno Rings

name: Quick Pickled Jalapeño Rings
recipeIngredient: 10 large jalapeno peppers, sliced into rings

recipeInstructions.text: Combine water, vinegar, sugar, kosher salt, garlic, and oregano in a saucepan over high heat. Bring mixture to a boil, stir in jalapeño peppers, and remove from heat. Let mixture cool for 10 minutes.
Pack peppers into two 8-ounce jars using tongs and cover with vinegar mixture. Cover and refrigerate until needed.

review.reviewBody: Used thia recipe to pickle a difderent kind of chilli pepper. I wanted to keep the heat of the chillies so followed other reviews that recommended using a quarter of the sugar. It came out very well. Thanks Chef John

After some mods this turned out perfectly to my taste. Way less sugar (1/4 tsp) to make it more spicy, added 1/2 sliced carrots and onions. Only one whole garlic clove and pulled out after the 10 min. Left serrano peppers whole but did poke holes in top and bottom so the insides could get filled. The oregano was a game changer. It was just like the name brand but more crunchy and less expensive.

I've made this a number of times, great recipe. I add a packet of pickling spice, which helps the flavour a lot. I try to keep as many seeds in the jar as possible to increase the heat. A jar of homemade pickled jalapenos makes a great gift for family or friends 😺

I have been making this for years. I used to buy pickled jalapenos until I brought home a jar of mushy jalapenos. I make them slightly different, I slice the jalapenos and stuff a jar with them, I boil the mixture in the microwave and pour it over the jalapenos into the jar. I seal the jar and tap the bottom edges to get the bubbles to rise open the jar and top it off. I repeat until no more mixture will fit. I posted a jar I just made and one made several weeks ago. Yummy!

This recipe is awesome! Friends have been making pickled jalapeños and giving us a jar here and there over the years so this year I decided to make my own and LOVE this recipe. They have a touch of sweetness and a touch of savory with the oregano. I cant wait to share mine with friends and I am thinking they will want this recipe!!!
I love this recipe. I did make a few changes. I put equal amounts of salt and sugar. Also I added some Juliane cut carrots. Turned out easy and delicious

Actually I have made this recipe several times over… it is awesome! I use fresh oregano from my garden, and I add garlic cloves and cut up baby carrots. I have always liked pickles, green olives and other deli items. This recipe keeps a slight crunch to the jalapeño rings, so I only leave them in the pan for the 10 minute timeframe. It is easy, quick and a great addition to eggs, tacos and quiche. So good!
Always comes out perfect. I through in a chopped up cayenne and a chopped up habanero for color and a kick!
I’ve made this three times. It works good. My kids think they are a little spicy, I might add more sugar next time to see what happens. They don’t last long though, might make a bigger batch.
Love this recipe! Didn’t have oregano, so I submitted Basil.
Awesome! I love that it was so simple to make and delicious to eat! 😋
turned out great.

Good basic recipe. I also added onion, black pepper, serranos, a bit of citric acid, and totally omitted the sugar. I live in NM and we rarely use sugar with jalapenos. This also makes a great salsa verde (with or without tomatillos.) Use lots of fresh cilantro for that fresh taste. Just blend to desired consistency. Serve with chips, meats, tacos, etc. I'm making mine for my Memorial Day hot dog fiesta! This is just one of the sides. Everyone should be able to get at least 3 hot dogs each so they can mix and match the toppings. Should be fun!
Just love this recipe easy and very good make it year round.

Quick, easy and delicious! I like some heat in my jalapenos, so I did not add sugar and added a teaspoon of chili pepper flakes and some pickle crisp to give them a bit of crunch. The best I've ever tasted!!!

I grow my own jalapenos and my peppers are very hot! I remove most of the seeds. I even double glove with those plastic disposable gloves and my hands still feel a burn afterwards. Don't touch your face!
Very tasty and addicting!
I really like the fast recipe! I put them in jars and will try them tonight!
So easy to do! Let’s hope this fall they taste awesome too
Very easy and good. I always double the recipe and eliminate the sugar. Sugar kills the heat.
This recipe is fantastic. Tastes great and everyone I share these with love it.

Love it! First time made it as instructed and it came out delicious. I’ve recently adjusted the recipe to my taste ie less sugar more salt added a bay leaf and carrots because I love spicy carrots. Can’t eat the store bought anymore.

I just made it and it smells great. really stuff the jar it's amazing how much it shrinks down. Also to be on the safe side just double the brine to start with. I will update later once I have sampled them.
Super easy to make. I did cut the sugar in half, like several of the reviews and added a little extra oregano as well as onions. I had several jalapeños from the garden and actually made 5 batches.
Pretty simple and easy recipe haven’t eaten them yet but got them made! Photo too big to upload I guess
I just made these, quick question is there an easier way to seed jalapeños, mine were very seedy. Anyway, very easy to make. Will make again.
Quick Pickled Jalapeno Rings by Chef John. Put peppers, garlic & oregano in jar then added remaining hot ingredients. Reduced sugar to 1 1/2T to retain heat.

This is such a great recipe and come the end of a long garden season the simplicity is appreciated. I use it on all spicy peppers - not just jalapeños. Once I got comfortable with the recipe I started experimenting with the amounts of sugar. I use less than 3 tablespoons for jalapeños but I will use the full 3 tablespoons for a very spicy bunch of peppers. But as always I follow the recipe exactly a few times until I’m comfortable with it and then going forward I make adjustments.

As good as the ones from the store - but I love that I can make them! I used jalapeños that I grew in my garden. 

I made three modifications: I only used 1 tablespoon of sugar, added 1/4 teaspoon of turmeric, and poured the hot liquid over the slices in the jar as other users suggested. I let these sit in the fridge for 36hrs before taste-testing. They are pretty hot!
This is my go-to recipe. I’ve made this many times now. An easy to follow recipe and they always taste great!
Fantastic recipe. I’ve been using this for our jalapeños all summer. I’ll hopefully not have to buy them from the store again. These are sooooooo good!!! And easy!!
Made than and they are great! I added onions and a pinch of dried chilli peppers to add some kick. Worked out great.

I don’t eat spicy so I’m not a good judge but my husband loves these! What I love about this recipe is that I can make them as the summer goes along and the peppers ripen. I usually use half jalapeños and half mild banana peppers because that’s what we’re growing and I get 2 thumbs up every time!

I've made this recipe several times. At first it was a little sweet and not so hot. However recipies are mostly guidelines. So I used a third of the sugar and chose to not rinse the cuts. Came out perfect. I trust the recipes from allrecipes.com.
I used half the sugar and twice the garlic. These were exceptional!
Little sweet alone, but pretty good when eaten on/with something else.

These are absolutely wonderful 
 Best I've ever had making lots this year
Quick & easy.

Easy peasy - and DELICIOUS! We always have a great number of jalapeño peppers in our garden, and I found this recipe a couple of years ago - we love it! THIS year we also grew poblano and regular (not hot) green peppers, so I'm mixing them all together and making at least a dozen large jars. YUM!

I have made these before but this time I tried to go from memory and completely forgot the sugar and I was a little heavy on the oregano and garlic but they turned out great! VERY HOT but DELICIOUS ! I will make again and just cut the sugar by half and see how that goes . Thanks for posting
Worked out great. So easy.
Have made several times. Love them in sandwiches. Gives a nice zip. Add slices of onions because they taste great pick

Just made these for the 4th. I saw a comment that these weren't very hot. I think it depends on the peppers you pick. Mine are very hot. We'll see this weekend. It was easy to make. I also added slices of red pepper.
I’ve been making this for the past few months. Love the recipe. I add some diced carrots for some extra color. Thank you!
Definitely a quick and easy way to jar your garden peppers and the sugar helps to tame a bit of the natural heat so they are more palatable for more folks.

Excellent! I love "all things pickled," but usually not a fan of adding sugar, so I used half (1.5 tbsp). I also used fresh oregano, and did not rinse the sliced peppers to keep the seeds in. Super easy and 24 refrigerated hours later, you'll have pickled jalapenos better than any store bought!

I made this with Serrano chili peppers and they came out perfect. My husband is the biggest pepper fan I know and he really enjoyed them. They are tasty, spicy hot flavorful and seasoned just right. I saved the recipe and it will absolutely be my go to recipe for my future pickling projects. Thank you for sharing it.

I am making this for a second time. I use less sugar by 1/2 and added some sliced carrots. Among the traditional uses, I like to add it to my homemade sauerkraut and also top my mung bean and lentil sprouts (all on the plate) for added zing. This is helping me use up my garden jalapeños.
Very Good, after we were done with the jalapenos, we cut up cucumbers and put them in the left over Jalapeno vinegar. So Yummy after it sat a day.
So good, way better than store bought! I've been eating them straight out of the jar - makes a great snack...might use a little less sugar next time.
I will never buy store bought jalapenos again! This was so easy, and they are fantastic! I like how they keep their crunch more than store bought. I will be making these all the time!!

I did add a few carrots and the second batch my son suggested that I add more acid like lemon or lime. I added two limes to second batch which made it even better. The owner and most of the workers of a pizza place I worked at did not eat pork. Sometimes they would buy beef but this is before chicken was popular on pizza. We threw out the rest on the canned jalepenos after tasting these. Jalepeno and Pineapple Pizza was a regular thing for the employees. We now make it at home. They used the garlic and herb dough balls from Trader Joe's
Pretty easy to make, just waiting to try them soon.
Tried and true recipe. Always great results. Heat is adjusted by removing some of the jalapeno seeds for milder results. My go-to gift for my Mexican food lovers.

Made these for the first time and they turned out great. I made no changes and followed the recipe to the T, except I used regular iodized salt instead of kosher salt. I gave pint jars out to 3 other families and kept a quart for my family. Everyone has asked me to share this recipe. Couldn’t be easier.
Perfect, taste exactly like the restaurants

I made the mistake of reducing the sugar by half and they still taste great but the full amount would have made them taste so much better! Also, added red bell peppers and carrots to the jar. Delicious
Do not add sugar- it will reduce the heat in the peppers. Otherwise excellent recipe.
These were fast and easy and gone right away..I like that they stayed alittle crunchy..sometimes they can be mushy..i will def make again!!!
Quick and easy! Will make it again!
I really liked this recipe. It was quick and easy to prepare. I followed the directions and was happy with the results. Thanks.
Easy Recipe I just replaced monk fruit sweetener instead of sugar. For Keto tell you how it turns out just did it.

Absolutely ADORABLE!!! OMG this is AWESOME!!!

I can't believe I have been buying the stuff coming out of jars for all these years.

Thank you so much for sharing this excellent recipe.

I added 1/4 of onions (string cut) and 1/2 carrot
Very quick and simple. Have made multiple batches. Good flavor
Super fast, super easy and dang tasty! After all, you're leader of the choir, of these these rings of fire.

This is my go-to pickled jalapeño recipe, I make it as-is, no substitutions, and love it. I will say, I tried to pickle other hot peppers (specifically cherry bomb) and the oregano wasn’t a good flavor profile match. But for jalapeños it’s great!

I followed this recipe for my first attempt at pickling. Took me awhile to figure out how to use them (my problem). Now that I have used them w/ red onions from the jar they tasted great in the salmon "Caseydilla" I made.
very easy
I quadrupled this recipe and it didn’t quite make 3 qts. 7x the recipe made 5 qts.
I quadrupled this recipe and it didn’t quite make 3 qts. 7x the recipe made 5 qts.

I've made this recipe 6 times, about to be 7 in just a moment. The first time I followed to a tee, and my husband found them to be too sweet to eat. So now I just omit the sugar and he swears they are better than store bought!
Only changes I made is I added a couple of cloves of garlic and some mustard seeds! Delicious!
Boiling of the brine sure clears the sinuses but it sure make great pickled peppers

My husband devours these in breakfast burritos, on burgers, on sandwiches, on nachos... you see where I'm going here, right? I also used only half of the amount of sugar recommended to keep them more on the spicy side and they. were. perfect. Perfect I tell ya!

I’ve never been a fan of jalapeño peppers until recently, all of a sudden I can’t get enough of them. These homemade ones are so delicious and superior to anything store bought I’ve encountered. I harvested a bunch of Serrano Peppers off my plant and decided to use this recipe to pickle them so they don’t go to waste. They are definitely missing the distinct “jalapeñoness” of the original but the brine still gives them a great flavor and their little zing adds a great pep to our dishes. I love this simple and easy recipe for dealing with an abundance of peppers! Thanks, Chef John.

I use a majority of my jalapenos from my garden on this recipe with no changes. I do a hot water bath with some to last the winter. Love these on sandwiches hotdogs and such. Once again Chef John delivers, love his recipes
Smells great
I made this it is a great and I will be making it again
I made no changes, and loved it the way it was. The jalapeño peppers stayed very crisp.

I followed recipe exactly and, man, they were WAY too hot for me! (And, I like relatively hot peppers.) I don't even know how some said they were too sweet, I couldn't taste sweet at all. I used about 12 jalapenos from my garden. Maybe they were just hotter than store bought jalapenos. I am going to try again, this time removing the seeds.
Great recipie. I tried it with other types of peppers too.. yum
Easy to make and they turn out very tasty
I love these. I grew some of my own peppers and used this recipe. They're still quite spicy; I may remove some seeds next time!
do you need a canner for these?

Our summer garden jalapeños are an annual treat when I use this recipe! YUM!!!

2019 I just picked a bunch of gorgeous peppers... canning jars are ready! I might make some fruit and jalapeño jelly too!
I used garlic powder instead of clove. I didn’t use oregano, I substituted minced onion. It’s a very easy recipe to follow, and doesn’t take long to do. Great for small batches.
I had extra jalapeños from the garden and gave this a try. They were still plenty hot despite the sugar, and super easy!
Quick and easy. Only 4 stars because they are hotter than the hinges of hades!
So simple and tasty.
Really good. Easy too. Only change I'd make is to cut the sugar in half from recipe as we don't like the sweetness and don't need to mask the hotness.
I made this exactly as the recipe states and they are delicious.
Easy and very good. It was a little sweeter than I wanted so I will cut the sugar down to 2 tablespoons next time.

Great recipe! I freeze jalapeños from my garden in the food saver. I find if I take jalapeños out of freezer and let sit for just a few minutes, they slice easily. I don’t buy the jarred variety anymore. This is an excellent use of my garden’s bounty. I make NO changes to recipe. Thank you for submitting!

I saw some reviews that it would be sweet so I added some extra salt! Love this recipe. I let it sit while we went to the store and came home to try it on a couple chips with beans, cheese and sour cream. YUM!!! No more store bought jalapenos. Thanks.
Have made this many times with great success. This time I added some sliced carrots to the boiling vinegar and water mixture to add a little sweetness and crunch to the mix.
These are delicious. Crisp and flavorful, just like they should be!

Fantastic !!, i made a huge jar full, i like mine with a bit more vinegar 2 thirds vinegar to 1 third water and i threw in a thin chopped white onion. Everyone loves them, they are so expensive at the shops but so cheap and easy to make.Thank you for a great idea.
I added red pepper flakes for a spicy flavor. I love these things, better than store bought

Been making these for about a year now...love them! I do use less sugar we like them hot, everything else the same but I double the brine. I do prefer to stuff my jar tight then add the very hot liquid and put tops on fast, as this will seal the jars. Cover the jars with a towel to cool and listen for the pop sealing sound. When sealed they can be put in the cupboard. If any jars do not seal then put in the fridge, and use first.
We loved this recipe and will definitely be making more. I did reduce the amount of sugar as we like a little heat. Easy instructions to follow
